page.title: 01A169,Bluebank to Pen Howe.P1
page.content:
The moorland,Whitby to Pickering,trunk road,{A169,}runs through the middle of this block from the northern edge at {Sleights}church to the southern side near{Pen Howe.}
Almost half of the area of the block is upland moor,most of the remainder being the farm and woodlands of the valleys of the{Esk}in the north,and {Littlebeck}in the east.
Centres of population are at the "top" southern, end of Sleights village and at Littlebeck village.The scattered farmhouses complete this rural scene.
The only rail link with Whitby passes through the north western corner,close to the river Esk,and Grosmont station. (Continued on next page)
